key_points: Radio host Dave Ramsey criticized another round of stimulus checks during a Fox News appearance.
Ramsey believes that if $600 or $1,400 changes your life, you were 'already screwed'.
He argued that people in need of the money have deeper issues related to their careers, debt, relationships, or mental health.
Ramsey views the stimulus checks as a temporary fix that doesn't address underlying problems.
He shared his personal experiences of bankruptcy and financial struggle.
Ramsey emphasized his commitment to helping people but criticized the stimulus as political rhetoric.
Congress is working to pass another round of $1,400 stimulus checks as part of President Joe Biden's $1.9 trillion rescue package.
Biden supports sending $1,400 checks to individuals earning up to $75,000 annually.
The push for more stimulus checks comes as many Americans face financial challenges due to the pandemic.
Last week, the Labor Department reported 793,000 new jobless claims, with around 78 million claims since the pandemic began.
spokespersons: Dave Ramsey (Radio Host and Financial Advisor)
